title: Home
text: We offer a range of generic reports within Imagine, including: 1. Overview 2. Index 3. Employee 4. Top List 5. Stock 6. Financial Stock Please note that the employee report is the only one that includes Gift Voucher sales. All other reports mentioned above exclude Gift Voucher sales from their results. Each of these reports operates as a task. When you choose to generate a report, the browser will continuously check the task service to determine if the report is ready. In the meantime, a screen will display the following: Once the report is ready, it will be presented on the screen for your review. Furthermore, on the report screen, you have the option to provide an email address, as shown below. If you enter an email address, you are not required to remain on the screen while the report generates. Once the report is ready, you will receive an email containing a link to view the report.
description:
We offer a range of generic reports within Imagine, including:


1. Overview

2. Index

3. Employee

4. Top List

5. Stock

6. Financial Stock


Please note that the employee report is the only one that includes Gift Voucher sales. All other reports mentioned above exclude Gift Voucher sales from their results.


Each of these reports operates as a task. When you choose to generate a report, the browser will continuously check the task service to determine if the report is ready. In the meantime, a screen will display the following:



Once the report is ready, it will be presented on the screen for your review.


Furthermore, on the report screen, you have the option to provide an email address, as shown below. If you enter an email address, you are not required to remain on the screen while the report generates. Once the report is ready, you will receive an email containing a link to view the report.

title: Sales Analysis
text: The Sales Analysis feature enables you to examine sales data based on different breakdowns. You can choose to break down the data by the following categories: 1. Store: This option allows you to analyze sales data specific to each store. 2. Clerk: You can view sales data attributed to individual clerks or salespersons. 3. Hierarchy: This breakdown provides an analysis of sales data based on hierarchical categories, such as departments or product categories. 4. Item: You can analyze sales data for specific items or products. In addition to selecting the breakdown category, you also have the flexibility to choose how the results are presented. You can view the sales analysis based on: 1. Quantity: This option shows the sales data in terms of the quantity of items sold. 2. Value: You can see the sales data represented by the total value or revenue generated. 3. Profit: This choice displays the sales data in terms of the profit obtained from the sales. With these options, you can gain valuable insights into sales performance and analyze the data from various perspectives to make informed decisions.
description:
The Sales Analysis feature enables you to examine sales data based on different breakdowns. You can choose to break down the data by the following categories:



1. Store: This option allows you to analyze sales data specific to each store.

2. Clerk: You can view sales data attributed to individual clerks or salespersons.

3. Hierarchy: This breakdown provides an analysis of sales data based on hierarchical categories, such as departments or product categories.

4. Item: You can analyze sales data for specific items or products.



In addition to selecting the breakdown category, you also have the flexibility to choose how the results are presented. You can view the sales analysis based on:


1. Quantity: This option shows the sales data in terms of the quantity of items sold.

2. Value: You can see the sales data represented by the total value or revenue generated.

3. Profit: This choice displays the sales data in terms of the profit obtained from the sales.



With these options, you can gain valuable insights into sales performance and analyze the data from various perspectives to make informed decisions.

title: Weekly Sales
text: The Weekly Sales report enables you to compare sales data on a weekly basis. You can analyze and compare sales performance across different weeks. The report provides the flexibility to break down the data by the following categories: 1. Store: This option allows you to analyze weekly sales data for each individual store. 2. Clerk: You can view the weekly sales data attributed to specific clerks or salespersons. 3. Hierarchy: This breakdown provides an analysis of weekly sales data based on hierarchical categories, such as departments or product categories. Furthermore, you can choose to view the results of the Weekly Sales report using the following metrics: 1. Quantity: This option displays the sales data in terms of the quantity of items sold during each week. 2. Value: You can see the sales data represented by the total value or revenue generated for each week. 3. Profit: This choice shows the sales data in terms of the profit obtained from the sales during each week. By utilizing these options, you can effectively track and compare weekly sales performance across different categories, gaining insights into trends and identifying areas for improvement or further analysis.
description:
The Weekly Sales report enables you to compare sales data on a weekly basis. You can analyze and compare sales performance across different weeks. The report provides the flexibility to break down the data by the following categories:



1. Store: This option allows you to analyze weekly sales data for each individual store.

2. Clerk: You can view the weekly sales data attributed to specific clerks or salespersons.

3. Hierarchy: This breakdown provides an analysis of weekly sales data based on hierarchical categories, such as departments or product categories.



Furthermore, you can choose to view the results of the Weekly Sales report using the following metrics:


1. Quantity: This option displays the sales data in terms of the quantity of items sold during each week.

2. Value: You can see the sales data represented by the total value or revenue generated for each week.

3. Profit: This choice shows the sales data in terms of the profit obtained from the sales during each week.



By utilizing these options, you can effectively track and compare weekly sales performance across different categories, gaining insights into trends and identifying areas for improvement or further analysis.

title: Financial Report
text: The Financial Report feature allows you to analyze transactions by breakdowns within a single store and a specified date range. Here's how it works: Filter: - Store: You can select a specific store for which you want to generate the report. - Include inactive shops: This option allows you to include inactive shops in the report if enabled. - Start date: Specify the start date of the date range for the report. - End date: Specify the end date of the date range for the report. - Refresh: Clicking this button will update the report based on the selected filters and date range. Result: The generated report will provide breakdowns for the following categories: 1. Total Sales: This represents the total sales amount for the selected date range. 2. Average Basket: This indicates the average amount per transaction. 3. Transaction Analysis: A breakdown of different transaction types, such as sales, returns, and exchanges. 4. Discount Analysis: A breakdown of the total and line discounts applied during the specified period. 5. Discount Reason Code Analysis: A list of discount codes used in transactions. 6. Return Analysis: Detailed information on returns processed. 7. Cash Statements: Provides details of cash statements processed within the specified date range. 8. Payment Methods: A list of payment methods used, along with the number of transactions and corresponding totals. 9. Time Analysis: Breakdown of transactions, items, and totals grouped by the time of day (hourly). 10. Tax Analysis: A breakdown of the amount collected based on tax rates. By utilizing the Financial Report feature with the provided filters, you can gain comprehensive insights into transaction details, sales performance, discounts, payment methods, and more for a specific store within a specified date range.
description:
The Financial Report feature allows you to analyze transactions by breakdowns within a single store and a specified date range. Here's how it works:



Filter:

- Store: You can select a specific store for which you want to generate the report.

- Include inactive shops: This option allows you to include inactive shops in the report if enabled.

- Start date: Specify the start date of the date range for the report.

- End date: Specify the end date of the date range for the report.

- Refresh: Clicking this button will update the report based on the selected filters and date range.


Result:

The generated report will provide breakdowns for the following categories:


1. Total Sales: This represents the total sales amount for the selected date range.

2. Average Basket: This indicates the average amount per transaction.

3. Transaction Analysis: A breakdown of different transaction types, such as sales, returns, and exchanges.

4. Discount Analysis: A breakdown of the total and line discounts applied during the specified period.

5. Discount Reason Code Analysis: A list of discount codes used in transactions.

6. Return Analysis: Detailed information on returns processed.

7. Cash Statements: Provides details of cash statements processed within the specified date range.

8. Payment Methods: A list of payment methods used, along with the number of transactions and corresponding totals.

9. Time Analysis: Breakdown of transactions, items, and totals grouped by the time of day (hourly).

10. Tax Analysis: A breakdown of the amount collected based on tax rates.


By utilizing the Financial Report feature with the provided filters, you can gain comprehensive insights into transaction details, sales performance, discounts, payment methods, and more for a specific store within a specified date range.

title: Customer Turnover
text: The Customer Turnover feature allows you to analyze your customer base within a specified date range. To get started, you can use the "from" and "to" date filters. You have the flexibility to select dates from the calendar or manually enter specific date ranges. Additionally, there are two toggles available to further refine the report: 1. Only Include Active Customers Toggle: - When set to ON: The report will only include your current active customers, excluding inactive customers. - When set to OFF: The report will display both inactive and active customers. 2. Only Include Customers with Turnover Toggle: - When set to ON: The report will include customers who have actively made purchases from your store within the selected date range. - When set to OFF: The report will include all customers, including those who have not made any purchases from your store. Once you have selected your desired options, click the "Load Report" button. This action will generate the report on the screen, presenting you with the analyzed customer turnover data based on your specified filters. By utilizing this feature, you can gain insights into customer activity and track customer turnover over time, helping you make informed decisions and tailor your strategies to improve customer retention and engagement.
description:
The Customer Turnover feature allows you to analyze your customer base within a specified date range. To get started, you can use the "from" and "to" date filters. You have the flexibility to select dates from the calendar or manually enter specific date ranges.



Additionally, there are two toggles available to further refine the report:


1. Only Include Active Customers Toggle:

   - When set to ON: The report will only include your current active customers, excluding inactive customers.

   - When set to OFF: The report will display both inactive and active customers.


2. Only Include Customers with Turnover Toggle:

   - When set to ON: The report will include customers who have actively made purchases from your store within the selected date range.

   - When set to OFF: The report will include all customers, including those who have not made any purchases from your store.


Once you have selected your desired options, click the "Load Report" button. This action will generate the report on the screen, presenting you with the analyzed customer turnover data based on your specified filters.



By utilizing this feature, you can gain insights into customer activity and track customer turnover over time, helping you make informed decisions and tailor your strategies to improve customer retention and engagement.

title: Transaction Report
text: The Transaction Report feature allows you to view a list of transactions with the ability to apply filters based on store, date, and receipt number. Here's how it works: Filter: - Store: You can select one or more stores from which you want to generate the report. - Receipt No. Contains: This option allows you to filter transactions based on receipt numbers that contain a specific value. - Start date: Specify the start date of the date range for the report. - End date: Specify the end date of the date range for the report. - Search: Clicking this button will apply the selected filters and search for transactions. Result: Once the filters and date range have been set, clicking the "Load Report" button will display the report. The report will show 10 results at a time and can be navigated to view additional transactions. Example Transaction: The report will present transactions with the following information: Headers: - Date: The transaction date. - Store: The store ID that processed the transaction. - POS: The POS ID that processed the transaction. - Receipt No.: The receipt number associated with the transaction. - Clerk: The clerk who processed the transaction. - Receipt Barcode: The barcode assigned to the receipt. - Connector: Additional connector information. - Customer: The ID of the customer linked to the transaction. Lines: - Item/Voucher/Web Order/Group/Set Description: Description of the sale line, depending on the type of transaction. - Item Number: The item number if applicable. - Item Group ID: The item group ID for the item if applicable. - Item Retail Price: The retail price of the item. - Quantity Sold: The quantity sold. - Total Inc Tax: The total amount including tax (Sold Price * Quantity). - Total Excl Tax: The total amount excluding tax. - Tax Rate %: The tax rate percentage. - Discount Amount: The amount of discount applied. Below the transaction lines, you will see the total amount of the transaction, followed by the payment method and the corresponding amount. To view more transactions, you can load the next 10 results by pressing the "Load More Transactions" button. This button will become inactive (greyed out) when no more results are available for the selected date range. By utilizing the Transaction Report feature with the provided filters, you can access detailed information about transactions, including dates, stores, receipt numbers, items, quantities, prices, discounts, and payment details.
description:
The Transaction Report feature allows you to view a list of transactions with the ability to apply filters based on store, date, and receipt number. Here's how it works:


Filter:

- Store: You can select one or more stores from which you want to generate the report.

- Receipt No. Contains: This option allows you to filter transactions based on receipt numbers that contain a specific value.

- Start date: Specify the start date of the date range for the report.

- End date: Specify the end date of the date range for the report.

- Search: Clicking this button will apply the selected filters and search for transactions.


Result:

Once the filters and date range have been set, clicking the "Load Report" button will display the report. The report will show 10 results at a time and can be navigated to view additional transactions.


Example Transaction:

The report will present transactions with the following information:



Headers:

- Date: The transaction date.

- Store: The store ID that processed the transaction.

- POS: The POS ID that processed the transaction.

- Receipt No.: The receipt number associated with the transaction.

- Clerk: The clerk who processed the transaction.

- Receipt Barcode: The barcode assigned to the receipt.

- Connector: Additional connector information.

- Customer: The ID of the customer linked to the transaction.


Lines:

- Item/Voucher/Web Order/Group/Set Description: Description of the sale line, depending on the type of transaction.

- Item Number: The item number if applicable.

- Item Group ID: The item group ID for the item if applicable.

- Item Retail Price: The retail price of the item.

- Quantity Sold: The quantity sold.

- Total Inc Tax: The total amount including tax (Sold Price * Quantity).

- Total Excl Tax: The total amount excluding tax.

- Tax Rate %: The tax rate percentage.

- Discount Amount: The amount of discount applied.


Below the transaction lines, you will see the total amount of the transaction, followed by the payment method and the corresponding amount.


To view more transactions, you can load the next 10 results by pressing the "Load More Transactions" button. This button will become inactive (greyed out) when no more results are available for the selected date range.


By utilizing the Transaction Report feature with the provided filters, you can access detailed information about transactions, including dates, stores, receipt numbers, items, quantities, prices, discounts, and payment details.

title: Promotions Report
text: The Promotions Report feature allows you to analyze your Promotions within a specified date range. To get started, you can use the "from" and "to" date filters. You have the flexibility to select dates from the calendar or manually enter specific date ranges. Additionally, there are 4 other fields available to further refine the report: Promotions Name/Code: The Promotions Name/Code refers to the unique identifier or name assigned to a specific promotion. It helps to distinguish and identify different promotions within the system. Shop: Refers to a specific retail location or store where the promotion is applicable select the required shop from the drop down. Vendor: Refers to the supplier or manufacturer of the products involved in the promotions select the required vendor from the drop down list. Hierarchy Node: Refers to a specific level or category within a hierarchical structure select the required from the drop down. Once you have selected your desired options, click the "Load Report" button. This action will generate the report on the screen, presenting you with the analyzed Promotions data based on your specified filters. By utilizing the Promotions report, you can analyze data related to different promotions. Apply filters based on shops, promotions, and vendors to narrow down the results. Group the data as needed and explore the report grid and KPI graphs to gain insights into the effectiveness of promotions.
description:
The Promotions Report feature allows you to analyze your Promotions within a specified date range. To get started, you can use the "from" and "to" date filters. You have the flexibility to select dates from the calendar or manually enter specific date ranges.




Additionally, there are 4 other fields available to further refine the report:


Promotions Name/Code:

The Promotions Name/Code refers to the unique identifier or name assigned to a specific promotion. It helps to distinguish and identify different promotions within the system.


Shop:

Refers to a specific retail location or store where the promotion is applicable select the required shop from the drop down. 


Vendor:

Refers to the supplier or manufacturer of the products involved in the promotions select the required vendor from the drop down list. 


Hierarchy Node:

Refers to a specific level or category within a hierarchical structure select the required from the drop down.



Once you have selected your desired options, click the "Load Report" button. This action will generate the report on the screen, presenting you with the analyzed Promotions data based on your specified filters.



By utilizing the Promotions report, you can analyze data related to different promotions. Apply filters based on shops, promotions, and vendors to narrow down the results. Group the data as needed and explore the report grid and KPI graphs to gain insights into the effectiveness of promotions.

title: Overview
text: The Overview feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range while also providing the ability to apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Add New Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor - Hierarchy - Attributes Once you select a filter option, you can choose an operator from the following: - is equal to - is not equal to - starts with - ends with - contains - does not contain You can also add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude a shop named "Manchester". Multiple filters can be added by clicking the "+" button, and filters can be removed using the "-" button. Group By: The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Date Range: Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date. Generate: Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections. Report Grid: The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, discount amount, return amount, turnover excluding tax, gross profit, gross profit percentage, number of sales, number of articles sold, average price of articles sold, average articles in the basket, and average basket amount. You can download the report as a CSV file. Graphs: The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon. With the Overview feature, you can analyze and visualize sales data within a specified date range, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.
description:
The Overview feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range while also providing the ability to apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works:


Filter:

To add a filter, click on the "Add New Filter" button. The filter options include:


- Shop

- Master Items

- Vendor

- Hierarchy

- Attributes


 


Once you select a filter option, you can choose an operator from the following:


- is equal to

- is not equal to

- starts with

- ends with

- contains

- does not contain


You can also add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude a shop named "Manchester". Multiple filters can be added by clicking the "+" button, and filters can be removed using the "-" button.


Group By:

The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item.




Date Range:

Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date.




Generate:

Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections.


Report Grid:

The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, discount amount, return amount, turnover excluding tax, gross profit, gross profit percentage, number of sales, number of articles sold, average price of articles sold, average articles in the basket, and average basket amount. You can download the report as a CSV file.




Graphs:

The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon.





With the Overview feature, you can analyze and visualize sales data within a specified date range, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.

title: Index
text: The Index feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range, with comparisons to the same time period from the previous year. You can also apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Add New Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor Once you select a filter option, the operator "contains" is applied. You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester". Multiple filters can be added by clicking the "+" button, and filters can be removed using the "-" button. Group By: The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Date Range: Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date. Generate: Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections. Report Grid: The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, turnover from the previous year, turnover index (turnover divided by turnover from the previous year), gross profit, gross profit from the previous year, gross profit index, gross profit percentage, gross profit percentage from the previous year, purchase value, purchase value from the previous year, purchase index, end-of-period (EOP) stock, EOP stock from the previous year, and EOP index (EOP stock divided by EOP stock from the previous year). You can download the report as a CSV file. Graphs: The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon. By utilizing the Index feature, you can analyze sales data within a specified date range, compare it to the previous year, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.
description:
The Index feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range, with comparisons to the same time period from the previous year. You can also apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works:


Filter:

To add a filter, click on the "Add New Filter" button. The filter options include:


- Shop

- Master Items

- Vendor




Once you select a filter option, the operator "contains" is applied. You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester". Multiple filters can be added by clicking the "+" button, and filters can be removed using the "-" button.


Group By:

The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item.




Date Range:

Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date.




Generate:

Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections.


Report Grid:

The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, turnover from the previous year, turnover index (turnover divided by turnover from the previous year), gross profit, gross profit from the previous year, gross profit index, gross profit percentage, gross profit percentage from the previous year, purchase value, purchase value from the previous year, purchase index, end-of-period (EOP) stock, EOP stock from the previous year, and EOP index (EOP stock divided by EOP stock from the previous year). You can download the report as a CSV file.




Graphs:

The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon.



By utilizing the Index feature, you can analyze sales data within a specified date range, compare it to the previous year, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.

title: Employee
text: The Employee feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range, split by employees. You can also apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor - Hierarchy - Attributes Once you select a filter option, you can choose an operator such as "is equal to," "contains," "starts with," etc. You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester." Multiple filters can be added, and they can be removed using the respective buttons. Group By: The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Note that the dimensions grouping will only display if you have configured Dimension types from within Item Management. Date Range: Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date. Generate: Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections. Report Grid: The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as the number of sales transactions, the number of items sold, average items in the basket, average price of items sold, average basket amount, turnover, returns amount, discount amount, gross profit percentage, gross profit amount, and turnover percentage by employee or grouping. You can download the report as a CSV file. Graphs: The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon. By utilizing the Employee feature, you can analyze sales data within a specified date range, split by employees, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.
description:
The Employee feature allows you to view sales data based on a specified date range, split by employees. You can also apply filters and group the results. Here's how it works:


Filter:

To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include:


- Shop

- Master Items

- Vendor

- Hierarchy

- Attributes


Once you select a filter option, you can choose an operator such as "is equal to," "contains," "starts with," etc. You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester." Multiple filters can be added, and they can be removed using the respective buttons.



Group By:

The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Note that the dimensions grouping will only display if you have configured Dimension types from within Item Management.




Date Range:

Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date.




Generate:

Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections.


Report Grid:

The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as the number of sales transactions, the number of items sold, average items in the basket, average price of items sold, average basket amount, turnover, returns amount, discount amount, gross profit percentage, gross profit amount, and turnover percentage by employee or grouping. You can download the report as a CSV file.




Graphs:

The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph shows financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph represents statistics KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the corresponding figures. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon.




By utilizing the Employee feature, you can analyze sales data within a specified date range, split by employees, apply filters based on different criteria, group the results, and obtain valuable insights through the report grid and KPI graphs.

title: Top List
text: The Top List feature provides a concise output displaying turnover, profit, weekly cover, and sell-through percentage. It also allows you to apply filters and group the results. Here's an overview of how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor Once you select a filter option, you can choose the operator "contains." You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester." Multiple filters can be added, and they can be removed using the respective buttons. Group By: The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Note that the dimensions grouping will only display if you have configured Dimension types from within Item Management. Date Range: Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date. Generate: Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections. Report Grid: The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, number of articles sold, gross profit, gross profit percentage, weekly cover (number of weeks of stock cover), and sell-through percentage. You can download the report grid as a CSV file. Graphs: The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph represents financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph also represents financial KPIs. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon. By utilizing the Top List feature, you can obtain a concise summary of key metrics such as turnover, profit, weekly cover, and sell-through percentage. You can apply filters based on shop, master items, and vendors, group the results, and analyze the data through the report grid and KPI graphs.
description:
The Top List feature provides a concise output displaying turnover, profit, weekly cover, and sell-through percentage. It also allows you to apply filters and group the results. Here's an overview of how it works:


Filter:

To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include:


- Shop

- Master Items

- Vendor


Once you select a filter option, you can choose the operator "contains." You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester." Multiple filters can be added, and they can be removed using the respective buttons.




Group By:

The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Note that the dimensions grouping will only display if you have configured Dimension types from within Item Management.




Date Range:

Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date.



Generate:

Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections.


Report Grid:

The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as turnover, number of articles sold, gross profit, gross profit percentage, weekly cover (number of weeks of stock cover), and sell-through percentage. You can download the report grid as a CSV file.




Graphs:

The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph represents financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph also represents financial KPIs. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon.





By utilizing the Top List feature, you can obtain a concise summary of key metrics such as turnover, profit, weekly cover, and sell-through percentage. You can apply filters based on shop, master items, and vendors, group the results, and analyze the data through the report grid and KPI graphs.

title: Stock
text: The Stock feature allows you to view stock and purchase figures, apply filters, and group the results. Here's how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor Once you select a filter option, you can choose the operator "contains." You can add a constraint to further refine the filter. For example, you can exclude the shop named "Manchester." Multiple filters can be added, and they can be removed using the respective buttons. Group By: The Group By toggles allow you to group the filtered results. You can select up to 4 groups, and the hierarchy of the groups can be adjusted by dragging and dropping them. For example, you can group by shop first and then by master item. Note that the dimensions grouping will only display if you have configured Dimension types from within Item Management. Date Range: Specify the date range for the report. The default is the past month from the current date to the current date. You can select a start and end date within a 10-year period. A calendar is provided for selecting dates, and you can also choose today's date. Generate: Once you have selected the filters, grouping, and date range, clicking the "Generate" button will display the report in two sections. Report Grid: The report grid presents the data. It includes headings such as EOP Stock (stock as of the end date), EOP Stock Purchase Cost (cost price of the stock as of the end date), EOP Index (EOP Stock / EOP Stock from the specified date range minus 1 year), Turnover Quantity, Turnover, Turnover Index, Purchase Quantity, Purchase, Purchase Index, Gross Profit %, and EOP Stock Sales Price. You can download the report grid as a CSV file. Graphs: The second section displays KPI graphs. The top graph represents financial KPIs, and hovering over the lines will display the chart figures. The bottom graph also represents financial KPIs. You can print or download the charts in various formats using the hamburger icon. By utilizing the Stock feature, you can analyze stock and purchase figures. You can apply filters based on shop, master items, and vendors, group the results, and examine the data through the report grid and KPI graphs.

Here's how it works: Filter: To add a filter, click on the "Filter" button. The filter options include: - Shop - Master Items - Vendor Once you select a filter option, you can choose the operator "contains." You can add a constraint to further refine the filter.
